newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine police rescue kidnap victim.
newsitem.headline: Philippine police rescue kidnap victim.

text.p: Philippine police on Saturday rescued a Filipino-Chinese kidnap victim and arrested her nine abductors.

Philippine National Police chief Recaredo Sarmiento told a news conference that the victim, Jocelyn Sy, was freed unharmed four days after she was seized by her kidnappers in her car in a Manila street.
The 70,000 peso ($2,455) ransom money was recovered along with several firearms and ammunition.
Sarmiento said he believed the kidnappers were responsible for a series of abductions in the capital. He did not elaborate.
Police said Sy was the 49th kidnap victim in the Philippines this year. Last year, more than 100 people were kidnapped by crime gangs.

Kidnapping has become a booming business with the amount of ransom paid out in the first three months of this year already exceeding the 142 million pesos collected for all of 1996, anti-crime groups earlier said.
Families of victims who are mostly ethnic Chinese, one of the country's wealthiest groups, are often reluctant to call in the police because they suspect police involvement. Conversion $=28.51 pesos
